summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel regarding an inquiry from the Office of the General Counsel (OGC) about a spreadsheet attachment submitted with a discovery request form related to the Epstein case. It involves coordination between the Victim Services Division and the New York Field Office.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: FBI employee in the Victim Services Division who is inquiring about an OGC request regarding Epstein discovery and mentions being in the midst of the case.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent, FBI New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: FBI agent in New York who is being contacted about the OGC inquiry regarding the Epstein discovery request and states they were not in the office that day.

connections.description: FBI colleagues communicating about an OGC inquiry related to Epstein case discovery, with the Program Manager seeking to coordinate a call.

events.title: OGC inquiry about Epstein discovery
events.description: The Office of the General Counsel inquires about a spreadsheet attachment submitted with an Epstein discovery request form, prompting internal FBI email coordination.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division and New York Field Office are coordinating on a discovery request related to the Epstein case.
An inquiry from the Office of the General Counsel (OGC) concerns a spreadsheet attachment submitted with an Epstein discovery request form.
The email chain indicates ongoing case management and communication within the FBI regarding Epstein-related discovery.
